intro: Erigeron collinus, commonly known as the cliffweed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as cliffs and slopes, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron collinus is often found in open, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
